cwe_description: The software reads data past the end, or before the beginning, of the intended buffer. This can cause a crash or other undesirable behavior, or may be used to read sensitive information from other memory locations.
explanation: The code uses cms->selected_digest as an index into the digest_params array without any bounds checking. If cms->selected_digest contains a value that is outside the valid index range of digest_params, an out-of-bounds read will occur. This can lead to information disclosure, denial of service, or potentially arbitrary code execution.

cwe_description: The software reads data past the end, or before the beginning, of the intended buffer. This can lead to crashes, information disclosure, or execution of arbitrary code.
explanation: The code uses cms->selected_digest as an index into the digest_params array without any bounds checking. If cms->selected_digest can be controlled by an attacker or can otherwise hold a value outside the valid index range of digest_params, it will lead to an out-of-bounds read. This can result in information disclosure, denial of service (crash), or other undefined behavior.
